name: Pregnant & New Mums Group South London
description:
Are you pregnant or a new parent? If so please join our group where we will create a space for mums to connect and create meaningful friendships during this life changing time 💕 having a baby is beautiful but it comes with such hardships and challenges, having other mums around you that understand this is invaluable. 

We will have regular meetups and a whatsapp group to support & get to know each other 😊

name: Clapham Cycle
description:
Welcome to Clapham Cycle
**\*Please ensure you have registered and been approved at [Claphamcycleclub.com](https://claphamcycle.com) before applying to this group\***
At our core, we all love cycling, it has brought us together, it keeps us fit and healthy, and we love exploring the beautiful countryside. 
We are open to all abilities, ranging our rides from newbie rides all the way up to long distance sportives. Our calendar is jam packed with activities, with the intention of having “something for everyone” and nobody gets left behind.
You will notice on our rides that we use a colour code system to differentiate the difficulty. To understand this better and to work out which level you are at please read our ability guide here:
https://claphamcycleclub.com/[abilityguide/](https://claphamcycle.com/abilityguide/)
We now have over 190 registered members, with 3-4 rides every week, and with multiple trips abroad.
In 2019 we completed 256 events in total and for 2020 we aim to complete even more!
Join us, meet some new friends, and become a part of the fastest growing cycling community around.
*Please read out Do's & Donts before attending any of our rides (link below)*
*[http://www.meetup.com/Clapham-Cycle/pages/Clapham_Cycle_-_Do%27s_and_Don%27ts](http://www.meetup.com/Clapham-Cycle/pages/Clapham_Cycle_-_Do%27s_and_Don%27ts)*
**Pace Groups**
We will never allow more than 10 people in a group, so we if have more than one leader we will split into two or three groups. We will then split the pace the best we can, the faster riders in group 1 and so fourth. So 1 leader equals 10 cyclists, this is why you will see wait-list for a while until another leader confirms.
**RSVP Rules**
Our rides are getting very popular, please only RSVP if you are serious about coming. There is nothing worse than having no-shows and then people on the wait list missing out. If you no-show 3 times without 24 hours cancellation notice you will be removed from the group.
**Use Strava?**
We have our own club, please join! [https://www.strava.com/clubs/199520](https://www.strava.com/clubs/199520)
**Facebook**
Like us on Facebook! This builds awareness and helps u grown the community. [https://www.facebook.com/Clapham-Cycle-1021910764524300/](https://www.facebook.com/Clapham-Cycle-1021910764524300/)
**Whatsapp Group**
We have a Clapham Cycle SLACK group which is really useful if for some reason you do lose the group, as more than one person on the ride can see your messages. Join here: [https://claphamcycle.com/chat](https://claphamcycle.com/chat)
**Feedback**
We value all feedback from our members, and in particular in relation to your experience on the ride. Please email ridefeedback@claphamcycle.com – We promise to review and ensure your identity remains anonymous if you so wish.

Happy Cycling :-) 
Thomas
thomas@claphamcycle.com

name: Richmond Park Rouleurs
description:
Richmond Park Rouleurs is a road cycling club catering for (nearly) all levels of ability. Whether you are looking to improve your group riding skills, get fit, train for a big event, or just looking to meet fellow minded people, then the Rouleurs could be the club for you! 
We are a non-profit organisation run entirely by volunteers. The club is affiliated with British Cycling and for as little as £35 per year our members get to take part in weekly rides, socials, holidays, training events, etc. If wanting to join as a full member then please go to [http://rprouleurs.co.uk/membership](http://rprouleurs.co.uk/membership). 
Our main ethos is to ride as a group, we stop for punctures, and leave nobody behind. We have many groups out of varying levels with the main purpose of getting back to the pub safely for a few beers with the rest of the team, though most club rides will require you to be able to ride 40-50 miles. If you are concerned about keeping up, then talk to one of our more experienced members.
We schedule laps around Richmond Park most Saturdays to encourage new members along. Whether a beginner or an experienced rider, we can find you the right paced group to ride with and meet some of the regulars on a nice leisurely ride.
Don't forget to check out our [website](http://rprouleurs.co.uk) and social networks on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/richmondparkrouleurs/), [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/RPRouleurs)and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rprouleurs/)!
Why not purchase some of our club kit and feel really part of the club! [https://www.saddledrunk.com/richmond-park-rouleurs](https://rprouleurs.co.uk/shop).
We have many exciting events coming up, including cycling holidays, monthly club socials as well as some epic rides.
Why not join in the fun?

[https://youtu.be/V9W0hmgvsXE](https://youtu.be/V9W0hmgvsXE)

name: Bromley and Beyond Entertainment Society
description:
All are welcome but we are a primarily a group of fun- loving over 40s who enjoy a wide range of events in Bromley, the surrounding areas and London.

So if you are finding it difficult to expand your social group or feel stuck in a rut, join us for theatre, quizzes, cinema and many more fun events.

You will need to become a full member with an annual fee.

The membership fees are charged primarily to cover charges by MeetUp to host the site and any profits will be invested back into the group with both a summer picnic and Xmas Party.

**THE BORING BIT BUT PLEASE READ.**
**Please ensure your profile includes a picture of yourself. This is so we can identify you at your first event.**
Please only join if you can attend an event within 3 months as we like to get to know all our members. 
This is primarily a group for people who want to socialise and make new friends. Please do not send unsolicited messages to other members. This will result in removal from the group.
There is often a waiting list for events so if you can not make an event, please change your RSVP to no as soon as possible. 
If you need to cancel on the day, please contact your organiser directly and not by leaving a comment on the site.
Three no shows will result in removal from the group.

name: Free Health & Wellbeing Events: Living in a Post-COVID World
description:
**Become healthier, calmer, and happier for you and your family in a post-COVID world**
A programme of free activities promoting health and psychological wellbeing over the Summer of 2022.

Welcome!

Here you will find a series of events in London's Westminster area over the summer, offering residents the chance to learn skills to improve their quality of life after the pandemic; and facilitating conversations between attendees so everyone can share their experiences, ask questions, and discover how everyone is coping.
You will learn skills on psychological wellbeing, healthy eating, physical movement, and mindfulness.
-> We will be offering a weekly outdoor gentle yoga class for parents & children to improve health and wellbeing, followed by coffee/tea and a group conversation;
-> Classes to reduce anxiety and stress for parents and children in a post-covid world;
-> Group discussions for exchanging experiences and coping strategies related to health, lockdown, vaccination, anxiety, conditions developed post-covid, and related topics.
Classes will be free to attend, but we request that you RSVP here as spaces are limited.

The events are part of the **Health Equalities Programme,** which is an initiative by Portobello Business Centre (PBC) in conjunction with the Royal Borough of Kensington & Chelsea Borough Council.

name: Active Muslims 🔴🟡🟢
description:
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

السلام عليكم / Greetings!
 
This group is for people who want to get active, love to be active, love the outdoors & love nature. Whether through hiking, biking, walking, kayaking, or simply volunteering, sharing and caring. name: Wild Women Book Club
description:
Women today are immersed in a culture that demands that they remain focused on a youthful appearance and outward beauty. We are missing the community, rituals, practices, and stories that support us as we deepen into the rich experience of womanhood.

We start with the group by reading the book "Women who Run with the Wolves". It has some profound things to say about the primordial feminine instinct that many have forgotten.

Women who Run with the Wolves is for people who want to understand each other, work on their identity and self-worth, and heal emotional wounds.

name: Ealing Ladies Social Group (for ladies over 45)
description:
What we're about

Dear Members to be


Welcome to Ealing Ladies Social Group!  This information is to let you know who we are and to inform you of the group ethics and values which are set to maximise the enjoyment of the group.


Ealing Ladies Social Group (ELSG) was set up seven years ago. The aim of the group is to have meetups on a regular basis aiming for members to meet-up at least a couple of times a month. All events endeavour to allow members to get to know each other in an intimate sociable setting to enjoy a feeling of 'friends getting together'. To encourage this, we may limit numbers of attendees for certain events and the group has a cap on the number of members at 40.


The membership fee is £10 on joining and then £10 every year paid by standing order to be paid on July 2nd each year – to coincide with Meet Up’s annual fee payment. It is important that you meet up with the group before your membership is approved.


All paid-up members automatically become ‘event-organisers’ allowing them to put up events.


Events - All members are expected to put up an event at some stage so that everyone appreciates the efforts that go into running the group. However, this is by rotation of members and only one member has to do this each month, so if we have 40 members your turn will only come around every 40 months! Outside of "your month", you can put up any number of events you wish, but please consider the day you put up events to avoid clashes.


Age range - Membership is limited to the over 45s to encourage common ground amongst the ladies.


Photos - When you join ELSG you are asked to include a photo that identifies you. This helps us spot newcomers at events. Some people choose to put up a photo of an inanimate object, which is unhelpful thus we are unable to accept members without a full-face picture.


RSVP - Once you decide to attend an event you must RSVP it. This lets the organiser and members know who they should look out for at the event. If no one RSVPs an event, it may be cancelled or rescheduled – so it is not advisable to just turn up without RSVPing! Moreover, if you RSVP an event and fail to turn-up you could leave the host hanging around by themselves – PLEASE BE CONSIDERATE!


First-timers - The first time you RSVP an event it is advisable to let the event organiser know this is your first time so they can make sure they look out for you or perhaps exchange numbers with you in case of any last minutes changes. There is a comment box beneath each event where you can enter text which is the best way to liaise with the event organiser.


Termination of membership – this is very rare! If you are considerate, friendly (especially to new-comers), non-cliquing, capable, reliable and engage with the ELSG site to keep up with events and notifications then I do not imagine you’ll have any issues :o)


ELSG has been running for seven years now and experience has shown us that members who run into difficulties are those who imagine that ELSG is an automated system – it is not, humans run it. It is important that members refer to the site to keep updated on events and news - no one has the time to hold your hand :o(


Last and most importantly - overall, we're a friendly group who enjoy a glass or two. If you fancy joining, have no major hang-ups and you’re friendly and enjoy a natter in addition to being a lady of a certain age, then ELSG is possibly the meet-up group for you.


Hope to meet you at an event soon!


Maria

name: The London Single Professionals Group - 30s,40s,50s

name: KBM - Kingston Badminton Meetup
description:
\-\-\-
The Tue session is mostly full - No space for new members
The Sat session has space for new members
\-\-\-
(Before adding you to the group, play badminton with us first)

Kingston Badminton Meetup (KBM)

This is a group for anyone who wants to or already plays badminton.

It's about having fun and meeting other people to play badminton with, at all levels of fitness and skill in a fun, friendly, and relaxed environment (safety to reduce injuries being very important).

We are a relatively small but very busy and established badminton group, having grown over nearly 5 years now.

We currently play on Saturdays, Tuesdays and Fridays, playing only with feather shuttles.

The sessions are roughly matched in skill level (generally):
Every Saturday - Beginners Level - Beginners (less than 1 year)
Every Saturday - Mixed Level - Lower Mid plus (1 year plus)
Every Tuesday - Mixed Level - Lower Mid to Int (2 years plus)
Every Friday - Mixed Level - Lower Mid to Int (2 years plus)

Hope to see you soon at a session

Regards
Mo Malik (KBM)(KBBM)
07789 513300

name: The London Warhammer Gaming Guild
description:
A Central London based group dedicated to all thing wargaming including: Warhammer 40K, Necromunda, Kill Teams, Fantasy, Horus Heresy, Age of Sigmar, Shadespire, Bloodbowl, and many more besides. 
From newbies to experts, those who just love the craft and painting, or having a social with fellow minds this group is for you.

We meet regularly in central London for gaming sessions across the Wargaming range, with a lot of popularity in the Warhammer range of games, Dungeons & Dragons. We arrange socials, throw events, and generally have a great time while doing it!
In short; there's something to keep every type of wargamer / role player happy.

We're dedicated to keeping it friendly, fun, and honourable. The club moto is '**Victis Honor!'** meaning "Honour to the vanquished!". With that, we instill a strong sense of fair play and friendly competition in all our members.  We will aim to match members fairly with people of similar skill and ability.
So, if you think your ready, sign up and come to our War Meet.  

Peter Davies
Club Founder

name: Indians in London

Welcome to Indians in London Group!

Idea is to explore London, make more new friends, network and have fun together! I started this group to meet other people who like to really get a feel of the beautiful city of London.

Good Vibes Only!

name: GIN (Gay Indian Network) The LGBTQIA Indian Network in UK
description:
Connecting (and supporting) the LGBTQIA community of Indian Heritage and the wider Diaspora with each other and their friends and allies in London and the United Kingdom.

GIN is a fun and sociable networking group for LGBTQIA community of Indian origin and their friends and allies that would like to get to know each other in a friendly group.

We have around 5 meetups per month (both physical and online). We also have a monthly “deeper connection” Saathi conversation group.
We organise trips to museums, places of interest, Indian restaurants, LGBTQIA social support events, Bollywood and Bhangra playing LGBTQIA clubs, And we also have the occasional fun party or two 😃

This group is open to all LGBTQIA people of any nationality or race that are interested in getting to know more about India and people of Indian origin.

To help our members stay connected, we also have:

1\. GIN & Lime Womens' group\.

2\. GIN Book Club & GIN Film & Arts Club\.

3\. GIN 1 to 1 Buddy Telefriending Service\.

4\. GIN Midlands for members in Birmingham\, Coventry\, Leicester\, Nottingham\.

5\. GIN & Bombay Tonic Whatsapp Group with over 140 members\.

Website:

https://www.gayindiannetworklondon.com

Twitter: @GINindianUK

Instagram: @ginindian

name: The Optimistic Entrepreneur - London, UK
description:
The Optimistic Entrepreneur is here to keep you motivated, positive and help you take action to achieve your goals.

**Is the glass half full or half empty?**  
Half empty? We will give you the right people to get you to fill it up.
Half full? We will give you the right people to get your glass overflowing.
**Win. Win.**

Are you taking steps to financial freedom? Do you feel stuck in the procrastination trap? Join us on the journey to discover:

The Optimistic Entrepreneur Meetup Group supports the policies and principles of Meetup. We make no guarantees and we do not offer financial services or assurances. All our workshops are FREE To attend.

name: South London Smashers LGBTQ Tennis Group
description: We are an LGBTQ tennis group based in South London. Come along and play some tennis, our current locations are Tanner Street Park and King George's Park. All tennis levels welcome, we run friendly, social tennis sessions where we play timed sets of doubles, changing partners every 25 minutes so you can meet and play with multiple players. Any questions, drop Ryan a message.

name: F.R.I.E.N.D.S
description:
Debate👩🏻‍🎓, Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️. All are welcome 🌍

Meet like-minded people for new friendships.

Then come on out and join us for our Free Speed Friending social!

We arrange for you to meet and chat with each other. This gives you an easy and convenient way to meet new people in a way that completely dissolves barriers. This is NOT speed dating and so you will be meeting both ladies and gentlemen in mixed groups. The intent is to create friendships.

One of the greatest benefits is that this tears down the walls of shyness. Many people have deep-seated anxiety when it comes to talking to people they don’t know. But when you push outside your comfort zones, this speedy connection opens up the door to allow you to easily communicate and work together with other members of the group.

Speed friending allows you to identify other people with common interests. The conversations that take place don’t have to be deep, profound or even scripted; simply discussing likes and dislikes may lead to future friendships. Often, people want to make new friends, but they aren’t quite sure how to go about it. With speed friending, you can start pursuing that goal.

How to participate: Free Events
Download the Zoom app for free on a desktop or mobile device.
After you click attend, you'll see the Zoom link to join the event.

What happens in the event:

1️⃣ Upon entering the event you will be in our virtual lobby where our event hosts will welcome you. We will explain how the event works.

2️⃣Group Activity - Breakout rooms with different topics. You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room with a topic. Participants can self-select and join different breakout rooms that have topics the host has created.

3️⃣ You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout rooms.

4️⃣ Once the event ends you can go to the attendance list and message your mutual matches.

🤔 Help during the event.

You can reach your event hosts at any time during the event.
If you click Ask for Help in Zoom, it will notify the meeting host that you need assistance.

Is it safe?
Absolutely - All our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session. if you have any issues, report them to the hosts.

❤️ Feel free to support the group ❤️

https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=2VALHT5MVY7C4
or
https://www.buymeacoffee.com/MeetUp

Important Rules
Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behavior will lead to immediate removal from the event.

⚠️Important Reminder ⚠️
Please ensure that when you register your attendance you actually attend the event. If you do decide not to attend please click not going.

name: Practice Jazz Jams | London
description:
*If you're getting started with jazz, looking to build up a repertoire of standards and learning to improvise with other musicians in a relaxed environment - try out the 'novice setlist' sessions*

*If you're already comfortable with the above, but are looking to improve the more nuanced aspects of your playing and over more challenging standards - then check out the 'intermediate' sessions*

This group is open to all levels of musicians who would like to learn and explore jazz standards & improvisation with others in a friendly & supportive environment

If you're new to the group and had some questions on how it all works just drop me (Xie) a message!

A contribution is charged to cover payment of the room hire, meetup's monthly organiser fee, and my time in organising the sessions.

name: Bexley and Bromley Belles
description:
We are a group of ladies 45+ looking to meet new friends in Bexley Bromey and surrounding areas. We enjoy eating out, fine dining, theatre, cinema, visiting London, walks, afternoon teas and breaks away.
To join there is a membership fee of £5 From then on fees are £10 every 6 months due in January and July.
Members are encouraged to organise their own events if they wish to.
Anyone not attending an event in 6 months or cancelling 4 times in a row will be advised and taken off the group. This will keep the group active and not just ‘full of numbers‘.
If for any reason you can't make an event please change your RSVP. This enables others to take your place and also means a likely refund of any monies already paid. Please note refunds can only be given if replacements are found. Anyone with 3 no-shows without changing their Rsvps will be taken off the group . Where deposits are asked for they are non-refundable. If an event is prepaid please pay by the stated date or no later than 2 weeks after event goes on the site. I will not be chasing payments up so if you haven’t paid you will be taken off the event.
Only people with photos on their profile with be accepted into the group - no animals flowers or cartoons please.
The aim of this group is to be fun, friendly and to try new places and things to do. We look forward to welcoming you.
Disclaimer: this group does not take any responsibility for injury or loss during events or changes of times dates and venues that are unavoidable.

name: Indian Women Over 40 Living The Life
description:
To meet like minded Indian woman who want to enjoy life over 40. Any Indian woman over 40 can join. Our events are geared towards laughter and fun.

All I ask is that you have a profile photo of your face so it is easier to meet & greet at events. Be respectful and courteous to our members, if not you will be removed.

Non-Indians are most welcome.

name: Dating for Single Professionals and Entrepreneurs in London
description:
Spark new connections and meet new people in London.

Join The Single Boss for Monthly Dating Events, tailored for ambitious singles. We welcome those who want to meet and date similar people on their wavelength. From professionals, to business owners and entrepreneurs with a busy lifestyle.

Run by Richard Baffoe-Djan along with hosts Jon Pellington and Anna Easton.

More Information:
https://in2.dating/thesingleboss

Website:
https://www.thesingleboss.co.uk

name: Central London Badminton Club
description:
Central London Badminton Club


We are a group of players looking for new members to join us for Sunday morning and Thursday evening badminton at Euston/ Kings Cross location. We play doubles badminton.


We usually play at Somers Town Community Sports Centre ( address: 134 Chalton Street, London NW1 1RX between 10am-12 noon (sometimes till 1pm) on Sundays and usually go for a quick lunch afterwards. We like to play early so that we can still enjoy the weekend with friends and family.

We also play during the week on Thursday evening - session (7:30pm - 9:30pm) at the same venue.


We are looking for new players whose standard is intermediate (mid) and above to join us (sorry no beginners and improvers or lower intermediate players). We like to play for fun; we have great games but not looking for those who play too serious - so no Lee Chong Wei's and Lin Dan's!


We want to ensure the quality of play while controlling the standard of the club, this means that players who are not quite up to the standard may be asked politely to leave.


We play with quality feathers; cost for two hours is £10, (if we play for three hours the cost will be between £12-£15 depending on number of players participating).


IMPORTANT BITS

• You will need to bring your own racket, if you need to borrow please message one of the organisers privately.

• You will need correct shoes and clothing

• Please ensure that you stretch and warm up before and after sessions to prevent injury.

• Your are responsible for your own well-being and we and the sports facility representatives will not be responsible for any injury, stolen or damaged property or any other occurrences during our sessions.


BOOKING SYSTEM & CANCELLATIONS

• If you want to attend the games, you must RSVP for yourself and any friend that you may wish to bring that is not a member.

• If you do not RSVP and attend, you will be turned away (as there is a limit to amount of players and we want to avoid overcrowding)

• If you RSVP and DO NOT attend (e.g. Late cancellations / no shows/ friend cannot attend) then you will be fined for the relevant session, unless you remove (or adjust in terms of friends) your RSVP at least 24hrs before the session start time. This will ensure fair access for everyone. The penalty still applies whether or not the spaces vacated were taken by other members. Penalty will be £10.

• If an event is full, members will have the option of adding themselves to the waitlist. When spots open up, members will be automatically RSVPed in the order in which they joined the waitlist. The cancellation policy still applies so please ensure you remove your RSVP if you do not wish to attend a session thus providing others a chance.

• People who abuse the system may have their membership revoked and banned from rejoining.

• Our decisions are final.

name: The BCS British Chinese Society
description:
We are the BCS British Chinese Society. Our meetup group aims to bring together Chinese and Asian professionals with social events, sports and cultural activities to network and make new friends.
我們是中英會。我們旨在將年輕的中國和亞洲專業人士結合在一起，結交新朋友，社交，體育和文化活動。

Our meetup events include:
\- Social networking drinks \(Chinese/Asian/UK\)
\- Meals \(Chinese\, Japanese\, Korean\, Taiwanese\, Vietnamese\, Malaysian\, Singaporean\, Thai etc\.\)
\- Outdoor and indoor activities: hiking\, bouldering\, cycling\, etc\.  
\- Tours: museums\, sightseeing
\- Board games
\- and your suggestions\!

Youtube
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSJuPtTKeBs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSJuPtTKeBs)

Instagram
https://www.instagram.com/bcsbritishchinesesociety/

Join our Facebook Group
[https://www.facebook.com/groups/britishchinese](https://www.facebook.com/groups/bcslondon/)

Like our Facebook page
[https://www.facebook.com/bcs.messenger/](https://www.facebook.com/bcs.messenger/)

Clubhouse 
[https://www.joinclubhouse.com/club/bcs-british-chinese-soc](https://www.joinclubhouse.com/club/bcs-british-chinese-soc)

BCS Online Magazine - Shared Horizon 
https://sharedhorizon.wordpress.com/about-us/

BCS is not funded by any bodies and staffed by unpaid volunteers who are in full time jobs. We would love members and everyone who loves attending to our events to voluntarily make a donation to the below link
[https://www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/bcs2](https://www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/bcs2)
To avoid confusion and for the safety of our members, new members will require an actual photo of themselves and real name (shorten is fine) or their membership will be revoked. Furthermore any malicious or offensive comments in the Meetup page or advertising of other groups (unless agreed with the Organisers' team) will also result in the members removal.

If you receive any private message from members you have never met before from Meetup or from any other social media medium or Whatsup and feel uncomfortable from them.  Please contact one of the BCS Organiser and we will have the offender banned.  

Finally for events that there is a requirement to pay for entry for our event (as a result of extra costs for the hire and services that needs to pay to suppliers in advance), unless otherwise stated, a request for refund 1 week before the start of the event without any prior notice will NOT be refunded. It is not acceptable for Organisers who are volunteers to pay upfront cost out of their own monies and then expect an Organiser to find a replacement in the last minute to pay for a refund from a confirmee of an event. 

Thank you for your co-operation.

name: London Online Business Training Meetup Group
description: How would you like to make money, be successful at it and never have to leave home? This group can help make that happen for you. We have some of the top instructors in the world who can train you to do just that. So come and join one of our webinars and they will set you on the path to easy success. The The webinars are usually less than a couple hours and the best of all it is FREE. It will be the start of an amazing journey that you should not miss. Next step is to join our group and start this amazing journey with all of us. You will not be disappointed.

name: How to run a successful business
description: Join our group of London-based businesses and entrepreneurs who want to have successful start-ups and gain more leads using online methods! Our events will help give you ideas, tips and tricks, and mindset coaching to help your journey through the business world.

name: Adventuress In The Wild
description:
Welcome to the Adventuress In The Wild Community!

We are a group of Adventuresses who love to hike, climb, camp, kayak and slackline together.

This is your community for finding like-minded adventurous women to get outdoors with. We will run frequent events including sunset walks, weekly bouldering & beer sessions, hikes around the UK, camping retreats and overnight hikes.
We welcome all levels of fitness and ability.

We are a friendly bunch, and most of our events turn into pub socials after!

\*This group is pro diversity and welcomes all LGBTQIA+✊🏿✊🏾✊🏼✊🏳️‍🌈 \*

name: Greater London All Pubs
description:
This is a meeting for people looking for friends or to enhance their social network. The meetup is open to professionals living and residing in London, so there are questions to fill in before applying. We will meet inside all the pubs of greater London. Pubs with too strong music or too thematic or little will not be selected, but we will endeavour to get inside all of the pubs. We will endeavour to visit all the pubs of London, so we will meet within the same pub only if the pub is very little and there will be a limited number of spots. In this case the people that have already been at that pub will not be allowed to join again to give to other people the opportunity to see that pub. Every week we will meet inside a certain pub and we will explore a different area only when we have called at all the pubs of the previous one. For example if we start with the pubs in Shepherds Bush we will get to all the pubs within the shepherds Bush area. There will be a charge only for selected meetings.
Please note : you don't have to purchase alcohol if you don't want to, the important thing is that you purchase something that appeals to you. At the end of the year or so you can say that you have visited all the pubs of London at least the ones within zone 1 and 2. Please note : we will only go inside public houses. Discos and bars are not included.
This Meetup group is not open to un respectful people, and is open to diversity, the attitude of members will be monitored by the organisers that pay the fees. Members will be monitored. Membership of other members requires approval.

name: LOVE: Events & Services
description:
I am Patience: meditation guide, energy healer, plant medicine practitioner, musician, artist, multi-dimensional being. Welcome to my Meetup page where you can find all my events. I run daily evening guided meditation trips on all different aspects of spiritual healing, and regular group sessions and ceremonies in London, Hertfordshire and Sussex.

If you want a 1-1 session, to look at this year's courses and spiritual retreats, and to discover all my services and offerings, please check out my website: https://love19962021.wixsite.com/love

I look forward to journeying with you soon! 👁🙏❣️

-Patience (Love)

Instagram: @andlifeisparadise
Twitter: @livingaslove

name: UK Tech Careers: Learning & webinars - By Ironhack
description:
The #Ironhack community is for the tech-curious and the experts. It’s a space for people to learn about tech careers from others who are already web developers, UX/UI designers, data analysts and cybersecurity professionals. Now in the UK, we’ll put together gatherings for people who want to learn and network. Join the UK #Ironhackers, alumni network and friends in tech.🙌

📌 What to expect:
✔️ Introductions to tech skills
✔️ Networking events
✔️ Career-focused sessions
✔️ Events by Ironhack Alumni
✔️ Valuable workshops to keep up to date with the tech industry
✔️ Much more to come!

You can also join our IN-PERSON only community for the London community! https://www.meetup.com/ironbeers-tech-community/

name: YC SUS London
description:
A group for YC Startup School founders in London to meet for coffees / beers and chat and all

Please keep this community high trust / high value. This is what makes the YC network so special. Let's keep it this way!

name: BLACK FEMALE FRIENDSHIP
description:
I decided to start this group as I was looking to bring together black females for authentic and genuine friendships. It's as simple as that really but it will be so rewarding, because just having one friend can bring you so much joy.

As we grow older friendships change, as do circumstances, our girlfriend circle gets smaller and smaller.. until we're left with that one slightly unreliable friend.

So I'm looking to bring together a group of black or mixed females, on a first come basis, to go out to places of interest - mainly black events, but non black also, wine bars, restaurants, birthdays, holiday & weekends away, cinema, shopping, theatre, jazz festivals anything goes!!

So now, after reading all this and you still want to meet more women like you, then please join. Also note, our meetups will generally be held over the weekends as this is most best for most people and the weekend is the best time to have some fun....Stay blessed. <br>

<br>

Please note that two No Shows will result in removal from the Group (which no one wants). If there is a waitlist of over 20, one No Show will result in removal, so updating your invite is required.

name: London Skate Group
description:
Welcome, all rollerskaters and rollerbladers ❤️

This is a group for people who want to meet other skaters regularly in London parks. It doesn't matter if you're a new skater or a seasoned veteran - this is for ALL of us to meet, have fun and skate our mighty hearts out.

We can teach each other new tricks, skills and techniques and of course, build new wonderful friendships too.
On days when the sun is out, we can picnic + skate, music + skate, laugh + skate - as long as there is skating involved we're good.

I started this group because I want to get back into rollerskating after a 20year hiatus 😅and I just couldn't find a community where I felt relaxed enough to release my anxieties.

Also, I want this to ideally be a free group so that everyone can join without financial restraints.

To join the group you must have your own skates, protective helmet and wrist guards (at least).

I look forward to skating with you soon.

name: International Friend Connection UK/Europe
description:
[goodifc.org](orgforgood.com)

Everyone in the world is welcome! We are a place where honest and kind people can come to make friends. It doesn't matter if you are anybody special, only how you treat other people. Are you looking for new friends and a place to belong? Would you like to find a place where you won't be judged? Take a break from the world and be yourself. We will help make your life happier by helping you establish authentic and genuine friendships. This is a global group for people who want to make friends on Zoom.

This group is part of the International Friend Connection family of Meetups

Nobody under the age of 18 is allowed to attend.

**Disclaimer**
These events are for entertainment purposes only and we do not give out any medical or professional advice. Please do not make any medical decisions without consulting a licensed health care professional.

name: Weybridge Social Events
description:
Hello

Thanks for showing your interest in this group.

This meetup group is ideal for single people and couples who would like to socialise and build up friendships. This group would suit anybody over 35 as long as your heart is young and your mind is open for adventure.

Events like beach and barbeque parties, walking, ten pin bowling, weekend trips will be offered and any other suggestions from our members will be considered during the year.

\-\-\-\-\-Fees\-\-\-\-

To cover any costs from e.g. obtaining documents for event planning, paying meetup fee, etc, most of the events will have a fee of £3




If you would like to host any event then you are welcome to discuss this with me.

\-\-\-\-General Rules\-\-\-\-

To join us, your meetup profile should have a clear photo showing your face and should be current and not be older than 3 years. Your profile also needs to show your real name. Without those two criterion, your request of membership will not be accepted or even deleted, even you have paid the initial joining fee of £2.

We reserve the right to delete your membership if your behaviour is inappropriate like rude, aggressive, confrontational and so on. At our age, we should already know how to treat people appropriately. Furthermore, we also reserve the right to remove a member who does not fit in the group whatever the reason is.
In the case you register for an event and later realise that you cannot join the event, then please change your attending status as there is usually a wait list and it is only fair to others. Failure to do this resulting in two 'no shows' will mean that you will be removed from the group.
 
\-\-\-\-Legal Disclaimer\-\-\-\-
By signing up for this group or any of the events, you agree that you have read and understand the below.
Additionally, by signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. The Group Organiser, Event Host or any other person is not responsible for your safety. Please ensure that you are fit enough to attend walks and bring sufficient water and food with you. For participating in other types of events (e.g. swimming, camping, bowling), you take part AT YOUR OWN RISK and are responsible for your own safety and well-being.
If you join us for any events or holiday, please understand that you are also responsible for your own preperation. You are responsible for making your own travel arrangements and any necessary travel insurance.
Participants are responsible for assessing their own risk, the safety of themselves and their guests and the suitability of any equipment used.
You have voluntarily elected to participate in the events and FULLY ACCEPT AND ASSUME ALL RISKS AND ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY INJURY, LOSSES AND DAMAGES TO PERSON OR PROPERTY THAT INCUR AS A RESULT OF YOUR PARTICIPATION.
We are not trained leaders, guides or first aiders and we do not employ qualified guides, leaders or first aiders at any events. There may not be rescue or medical facilities or expertise necessary in the immediate area to deal with the Risks to which you may be exposed during our activities. 
The Organizer’s role is to coordinate the gathering of people at the appointed meeting place for the group to voluntarily take part in the organized Event. It is the same basis of being a group of friends or voluntaries who are undertaking activities (indoor or outdoor) together who invites others to join any activities on this basis via the Meetup web site.
Remember: YOU ARE ATTENDING ALL EVENTS AT YOUR OWN RISK.! 
PHOTOGRAPHY
This group may, from time to time, take photographic, digital or video images of event participants for promoting the group. You hereby agree to allow this group to use those images for that purpose without expectation of privacy or renumeration.
PLEASE DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY ORGANIZED EVENTS UNLESS YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREED ITS ENTIRETY.
 We are looking forward to meeting you.

name: Havering Friends & Social Group
description:
If you are looking to extend/build your friendship group or just wish to socialise more with others, the Havering Friends and Social Group is for you!

We offer a wide variety of events to those that live in and immediately surrounding the Havering area. Idea age is 40 plus. Suggestions for meets are welcomed and we encourage all members who wish to host to contact one of the organisers.

All organisers and event hosts arrange meets in their own time. We don’t get paid to do it and we are not professional event organisers. we want to help other members as much as possible but we all have to take responsibility for ourselves.

There will be an annual £10 membership charge payable upon you RSVPing your second event, this is paid via PayPal and you will be contacted to arrange this. This helps cover the charges made by meet-up.

All we ask from all members is that they are courteous and respectful of others. Keep your RSVP up-to-date - please change it if you can no longer make an event. Hope to see you soon

name: Up In The Cheap Seats - Enjoying London Theatre
description:
Welcome to **up-in-the-cheap-seats**. This group aims to bring together people who share a common aim - to *see theatre at reasonable prices*.
All are welcome at our events - We've met so many lovely people and everyone has been so friendly and enthusiastic. Group sizes vary so we can meet up before and get a chance to talk to each other. We have a great group of organisers with varied tastes and interests; which keeps our calendar filled with mainstream and more eclectic events.
With over **2,200 events** in the 10 years we've been going, the variety of shows we've seen is immense. We see a mixture of musicals, plays, opera, ballet, music, comedians and films and are always open to new suggestions! A calender of our events can be found here: [https://www.meetup.com/Up-in-the-cheap-seats/events/calendar](https://www.meetup.com/Up-in-the-cheap-seats/events/calendar)
**There is a one-off joining fee of £2.50** to be a member of **up-in-the-cheap-seats**. These funds will be used to cover the meetup fees and cover expenses associated with running the group. 

Please note, if you are an inactive member for many months (i.e. if you don't log into the website or don't attend any events), you will be removed from the group as we encourage this group to be as active as possible.
So......how does it work? 

**We buy our own tickets.** Your event organiser will add a link on the event invitation so you can buy your ticket at the same price that they enjoyed. Obviously the price is not guaranteed especially if the show is popular or you wait a few days before booking.

**Please update your RSVP to confirm that you are joining us.** The organiser will normally add a comment to the event page saying which seat they have purchased. This isn’t mandatory but helps others decide on their seat selection – it is always nice to be sat near or next to another member of the group! The group does not charge to attend individual events (just the one-off £2.50 joining fee). Therefore Meetup states that the event is free. This does not mean that your ticket is free - you will need to purchase this yourself.

The event host will post the meet up details a day or two before the show.

We usually meet outside the theatre or in one of the theatre's bars around 30 minutes before the show.

If there is an interval we will meet up again in the bar at the interval so we can all share our opinion of what we have enjoyed (or not!) so far.

We will also usually meet up afterwards for a brief chat about the show but sometimes (depending on how late it is and the day of the week), we may go on somewhere for a drink and a longer chat.

**If you are unable to make an event, please change your RSVP** so that your host knows not to wait for you.  

Hope to see you at an event soon,
**Your UITCS Oraganisers**
\*Please note, this group does generate a lot of email, but the good news is these settings are customisable, and can easily be changed by going to 'My Profile', then 'Emails' and 'Notifications'.

name: Walking and Wine Women's Group
description:
A women's social group for over 40's based around Ealing/West London.
Walking and wine are two of my favourite things along with good company, food and occasional gallery/film/theatre - events will reflect this. Locations will be a combination of local, central and further afield green places.
Idea is to have a relatively small active membership group (capped at 70) with events of around 6-8 people so everyone can get to know each other.

Membership notes:
\*A photo showing your face is required to join this group.
\*Please sign up to events with consideration, 'no shows' or late cancellations will likely result in member being removed from group.
\*To maintain a small active group non-active members will periodically be removed.

If you have ideas for events or would like to host your own let Babs know.
Bring with you a friendly, generous and inclusive attitude.

name: Social Buddies (Middx Area)
description:
> **Are you looking to improve your social life and make some new friends?**

**Then come along to Social Buddies!**
Social Buddies is a lively, fun, social club for the 35+ age group with many events each month, mainly in the Middx area.
Our events include quizzes, pub nights, meals, live music/tribute bands, comedy nights, theatre, cinema, coffee mornings, craft events, days out and walks to name a few.
As well as attending events we especially welcome new members who are keen to host events themselves. The more people that do this the more events we can offer!
There is a joining fee of £10 which helps to cover admin and website costs. This fee is payable no later than 8 weeks after joining.

Please use your real name when joining and have a recent photo of yourself (clearly showing your face) as your profile picture. This helps members put a face to a name at events and know who to look out for.  Failure to do this will result in your membership being rejected.
If you require further information please email socialbuddies@gmail.com.
We look forward to meeting you at an event soon.
**Don't sit at home on your own - come out and have some fun with Social Buddies!**

name: True Dating - London's Leading Singles Events
description:
True Dating host London's leading speed dating and singles social events. We've hosted hundreds of dating events, all across London and pride ourselves on giving our members the perfect opportunity to meet lots of single people, in a safe and welcoming atmosphere. We started the company as we had tried all kinds of dating events and found most of them really disappointing. It seemed impossible to find fun, reasonably priced and most importantly brilliantly hosted singles events. So we decided to host our own and we truly love what we do.

Unlike other meet up groups we are actually a full time run business, with a brand new website and members account area so you can match and message with anyone you meet at one of our events. We also have customer service 7 days a week to handle any questions you may have.

Our speed dating and singles social events are mainly targeted at men and women aged 25- 55 in the London area and are hosted by our professional team. Creating a friendly yet exciting environment, our hosts are there to keep things relaxed yet exciting and help with those all important ice-breakers. They don't just say hi and leave you to it, they'll be there the whole night making sure everyone is having a great time.

And our True Dating guarantee is if you don't meet at least one person you'd like to match with at any of our events, your next event is completely free!

To find out more about us and book tickets please check out our website: www.truedating.co.uk

name: London Lesbians & Queer Womxn
description:
A million welcomes into our little corner of the Meetup community, a place to meet likeminded womxn and non-binary people in the ever so brilliant city of London!


This group welcomes all womxn and non-binary people who like womxn and non-binary people! Whatever sexuality you identify as, from lesbian-bisexual-pansexual-queer-gay this group is inclusive.  


We are also age, ability, race, cultural identity and everything else you can identity as inclusive. We never tell you how to look or identify to attend an event or restrict you narrowly to just identifying as 'lesbian'. Occasionally we might run an event which is specifically targeted as part of our community and if we do that we will always tell you why (an example might be an event centred around black, asian and ethnic minority members, dating for a specific group or for vegans); this is never to exclude you but to connect an even more marginalised membership of our community or where members might share a very specific common interest.


We are super friendly, always welcoming to our new and regular members, and no matter who you arrive with or arrive alone, you will most definitely leave with new connections and awesome people to hang out with at future events or meet with outside of the group.


I know how daunting it can be to come to your first event. Will anyone talk to me? Will I connect with other members? Will the ground open and swallow me right up? I promise after the first few minutes of nerves, you'll have been greeted by one of our lovely hosts and be made to feel part of the furniture. If you are super nervous please alert your host in advance and I recommend to always arrive at the start when it's slightly quieter and you can get more individual attention from your host.

With the sharp decline of bars for queer womxn and non-binary throughout London, Meetup really is the best way to network and make new connections. Events will be varied, including food, film, drinks, art (although right now during Covid-19 times were are much more restricted to meeting online). If you would like to organise an event get in touch! We are always looking for diverse hosts who are representative of our awesome community.

PLEASE READ

To enable us to build a great community please treat any events you sign up to as if you were meeting a friend; unless you have an emergency (sometimes life gets under your feet!), make sure to turn up on time and give plenty of notice if you are unable to attend. It is only courteous. Imagine if you arranged to meet a friend and you never showed up... that friendship wouldn't last long!

Please note this is a group for adults (18+)

PLEASE DONATE


Meetup currently charges organisers $180/year to maintain these event pages on their platform. 

If you can, please donate just a few pounds to the group host via PayPal (LQWmeetup@gmail.com) when you join to help cover these fees. 


Those with access to a steady, living income or other wealth are encouraged to donate more. 

Please do not be deterred from attending if financial hardship prevents you from donating.


MAILING LIST

Please sign up here: https://mailchi.mp/28160a803d0b/llqw

name: Metropolitan Walkers - walks in London and the South East
description:
**Metropolitan Walkers is the largest London-based Ramblers group for people in their 20s and 30s.**

All our planned walks can be found at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/wal...](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks) We publish to MeetUp to showcase our activities to a wider audience!

If you've not walked with us before, you’re welcome to come along on three free walks before becoming a member, to see if Met Walkers is for you! Membership is just £34.50 per year, or £20.50 concessionary rate.

We’re a very active group. Our volunteers lead walks every weekend, ranging from short, leisurely walks to strenuous hikes of 17+ miles across hilly terrain. We also lead one evening stroll during the week, discovering different parts of the capital.
We explore the beautiful areas near London such as the North Downs, south coast and Chilterns, all of which are accessible by public transport.

A lot of our members walk regularly, which is a great way to form friendships. As well as walking, we have a regular social programme.

We regularly run weekends away to explore the other great walking areas the UK has to offer, such as the Lake District, Snowdonia and Scotland, and have also put on several trips abroad.

We’re part of the Ramblers – the charity that helps everyone, everywhere, enjoy walking; and protects the places we all love to walk.

Follow us on Instagram @metwalkers [https://www.instagram.com/metwalkers/](https://www.instagram.com/metwalkers/)
Follow us on Twitter @metwalkers [https://www.twitter.com/MetWalkers/](https://www.twitter.com/MetWalkers/)
![](https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/7/0/4/600_432942756.jpeg)
Registered charity 1093577. Metropolitan Walkers is a part of the Ramblers - Britain's walking charity.

name: Queer Neurodivergents and Alternatives
description:
This is a social group for queer people who are also neurodivergent and/or alternative (as both neurodivergent and alternative people are often in the minority in the queer community). We are not an official support group but people are welcome to talk about what's happening in their lives, both good and bad. Our events are intended as a space where queer people can socialise and/or form connections with other like-minded queer people without worrying about being judged for being "different".

Queer covers people who identify as:

* Gay/Lesbian
* Bisexual/Pansexual
* Transgender/Non-binary/Agender/Genderqueer
* Intersex
* Asexual/Aromantic
* Any other minority of gender/sexual orientation covered by the "queer" umbrella term

Neurodivergent covers anyone who feels their brain is wired differently (no diagnosis required). A non-exhaustive list would include:

* ASD/Asperger's
* ADD/ADHD
* Dyspraxia
* Learning difficulties
* OCD
* Borderline Personality Disorder
* Bipolar Disorder
* Schizophrenia
* General Anxiety Disorder
* Anyone who feels that they don't "fit in" at conventional queer groups, finds them overwhelming
* Anyone who finds small talk exhausting

Alternative covers people who identify as:

* Goth
* Metalhead
* Punk
* Anyone who feels that their aesthetic and/or music tastes don't "fit in" at conventional queer groups

We are hoping that strict rules will not be required, but in general, try to be kind and compassionate towards others, and if someone tells you that your behaviour or words are making them uncomfortable, please stop.

We will aim to seek out quieter venues whenever possible as a lot of neurodivergent people are uncomfortable with noise. We will also endeavour to book venues which are accessible for people with mobility issues, and will make it clear in the event description whether the venue is accessible.

As we are starting out, we may need to try out several different venues to find one that works well. If you have suggestions for venues, especially queer ones, that are quiet and accessible, please do let us know.

name: Guildford Friendly Meetup - Friendships, Events & Activities
description:
A group for people based in and around Guildford, UK to enjoy life and make friends!

As we emerge from lockdown, events in this group will be very varied and include Walks, trips to Restaurants, Festivals, Theatre, Cinema, Bowling, Pubs, ice skating and trips to London to name a few examples.


We are very open to new ideas, this group will be a collaborative effort and led by the interests of members. If you have a suggestion for something fun to do, don't hesitate to get in touch.


We really looking forward to seeing you and to the fun events we'll arrange together 😊 we're always on the look out for event organisers, so drop us a line if you want to help!

name: Prince Charles Cinema Social Group
description:
A group for those of us who find the Prince Charles to be our Spiritual Home (cinematically speaking).

Anyone who loves watching movies in this historic cinema should join to do this is in a social context with like minded people. The Prince Charles Cinema shows a rotating programme of cult, arthouse, and classic films alongside recent Hollywood releases – typically more than ten different films a week on two screens. Occasionally we will do events at BFI and independent cinemas that reflects the films we love.

We will have events covering everything from single movies to marathons with a drink before or/and after.

We welcome anyone who would like to host a film.

name: London Powershuttlers Badminton Club
description:
We are badminton enthusiasts playing at Clapham Junction area. We aim to play socially to stay active and fit. We play friendly but competive games during the sessions. We occassionally participate into interclub games and compete to some social club tournaments.

We welcome everyone who shares the same love with badminton. You should at least have the ability and skills more than just basic badminton. If you are a complete beginner kindly contact organizers for the schedules of the sessions with those level so you may enjoy the game session.

We are generally super fun and friendly group and would love to hang around for snacks and drinks after the game.

We play with good quality feather shuttlecocks. Game venues will be announced per session booking.

Feel free to send inquiries at: londonpopwershuttlersclub@gmail.com

name: Get a Tech Developer Job
description:
Trying to find the missing link between training and a Developer Job?

Lots of people spend time and money to get the training and then struggle to make the leap between learning the skills and getting the job.

We’ve been there and got it, so we’ve built the bridge to help. Join us Monday night where we’ll be giving training on how to build the skills you need using web scraping as a starter, explaining employability and how the bridge can help you get where you want to be.

Our aim for you:

> We will build your coding and developer skills
> We will shape your CV building on what you are to make you attractive to your target employers
> We will market you and your CV through our extensive network of CTOs, CIOs, Devs and Recruiters
> We will give you access to powerful tracking tools to coordinate your marketing via MyCVTracker
> Access to Assessment tools so you can compare your skills to others (in a safe private assessment) and build the areas you need to
> Access to training in Blockchain skills to increase your marketability (Bonus)
> Networking with our network of professionals
> Accountability for your employability efforts to drive you on each day and week
> Access to mock-interviews to build your interviewing techniques and confidence

name: Chillout London
description:
Bringing like-minded people with the same passions together in a fun social setting for FREE. Whether it's a particular genre of music/club night/dancing,  theatre/acting, food, singing/rockaoake, sports/fitness, comedy, art, pub crawls, cutting edge science, spirituality actvities - we host free fun themed events to ensure only like minded people with the same passions get to meet and particpate as life is too short to spend time with people who do not excite and or engage you.

Our membership is biased towards successful but unpretentious career professionals with highly engaging personalities who are are socially skilled, outgoing, intellectually curious and creative with outstanding sense of humour! We value quality over mediocrity so attempt to constrict attendees to people with an authentic love of the event theme to both foster good engagement dynamics & keep attendees to a manageable size.

Our London events are hosted by a born Londoner who know the city and hidden gems inside out! We also avoid holding events in touristy/sleazy venues so attendees get to enjoy authentic London venues & experiences and meet native brits anf form long lasting connections easily. Typical past events have included stargazing, rockaoke, music themed clubbing events (80s, 90s, 70s, 50s, Hip Hop & Reggae nights), sports events (badminton, rounders, tennis), Halloween pub crawls/tours, exhibitions, dinners/food tasting/supper club, lunches/brunch, coffee, firework displays, talks/seminars, concerts - you name it - we've done it!

Waiting lists wise - when places become available, preference will be given to people with complete profiles who can demonstrate a genuine passion for the event theme, to the most loyal members and those with a close proximity to event location so it is parmount you fill out your profile!!

And here at Chillout, our philosophy is you shouldn't have to pay a premium to enjoy the things that you love so in accordance with the fundamental founding tenet of Meetup - the vast majority of our events are free - no profit motive here! However in rare cases, where direct or venue hiring costs are incurred for putting on a specific event, there maybe a small charge.

So, whether you’re originally from London or brand new to the city, here's to enjoying some memoriable crazy times out with a select audience and even forming strong new authentic long lasting connections along the way.

Lucas - Founder & Organiser (and essay writer!)
***Please note, if you are identified to having different motives for attending events other than for socialising around a shared theme that you are truly passionate about or found to be harassing members or seeking sexual conquests you will be removed. For security screening and protecting our members - everyone must have a full face pic prior to attending an event so they can be indentified in the case of any issues. If any ladies recieve unsolicited contact from random people they have never met please feel free to report to me (so I can remove) and contact meetup site directly.*** 

Feel free to follow us on Twitter to Keep updated with new events here:
https://twitter.com/Chillout_London
https://twitter.com/LucasBulsara
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
And now for some blatant testimonial marketing (generous bank transfers on way):

"His energy, event passion, beauty and brief conversation shifted my mindset tremendously in less than a few minutes which is very rare when attending meetups" Clare

"I went to Chillout London when I was new to the city from the USA and I always had a really great time. Everyone was super friendly. Lucas always has cool captivating themes and I always felt deeply engaged, never bored. I would definitely recommend!" Staci Schidmt

"The organiser is late often and as a former teacher I have no idea how he made it through school or university without being expelled but his events are so novel & addictive I just can't stay away" Reena Teacher

"Meeting Lucas and attending his event was a lovely experience. He had so much knowledge and passion. It was really good. Very impressive" Komal

"It's about time Lucas grew up, got a girlfriend/got married like the rest of his mates instead of wasting his time on this meetup nonsense. He should be hanging out with his real friends!" Adam Joslin

"The organiser is one of the funniest entertaining people I've met. He is really passionate about all his event themes and so there is always an air of excitement and never a dull moment. Now I'm a semi regular - I always leave either learning something new or laughing on the way home"  Lorraine Norton

"Organiser jokes around a lot but I love him. When he was DJing at his club event party he refused to play Never Tear Us Apart for me so if you like good music I suggest you avoid Chillout events" Dominika Abel (Assitant Organiser)

name: Bored in West London. Ages 35 to 55, all of 40s
description:
Enjoying life without breaking the bank.
Keeping it local but Posh.
Stylish and smart.
Let's enjoy the summer together.

Come along to any of our meetups all around West London and beyond.

Live Music.

To serve different members of the group, we will aim to schedule a diverse range and types of meetups. This can be at weekends or evenings, daytime or weekdays. name: Together, We OpenSource. Free. Remote-first. Worldwide.
description:
Marketing first - we really need to reach more people, so please help:
Please subscribe to our [YouTube channel](https://youtu.be/z4AFJO5FhRw?sub_confirmation=1), [Twitter account](https://twitter.com/NikitaKoselev) and [GitHub project](https://github.com/nikitakoselev/TogetherWeOpenSource).
We are sharing a lot of the amazing career-related and OpenSource content there.

**Objective:**
We want to empower people, especially those from the disprivileged background and with limited IT skills to become IT professionals by contributing to OpenSource projects.
We also aim to help experienced devs, teaching them to evolve faster by contributing to OpenSource projects.

Details:
The world is dying.
Well, we might be overly pessimistic, but the number of challenges is great and the number of efficient contributors to software solutions is not high enough. It has never been.

We need developers to help save water and energy, and prolong the lives of both humans and animals. The list of challenges is too long to list all of them here.

However, it takes months to find a suitable developer for a project, even in the world of finance, where money is not the biggest problem. Now try to imagine, how hard may it be for nature-related projects, like NationalTrust (UK), Greenpeace, and many others.

That is where we help. We help people of any degree of IT proficiency to get into OpenSource. We help people to become a true part of the Open Source Community. Our goal is to help them to impact society in the most positive way, while quickly and powerfully progressing their IT skills.

Our goal is not to grow the “alike developers”, but rather to help each person to realize this individual’s strengths and build on these.
Every single person with the most basic IT knowledge can contribute to OpenSource, a lot.

No coding skills are actually required. Numerous roles in Open Source do not require coding skills.
Also, you might notice that your coding skills will just appear, at some point in the future ;)

We need to give this world a chance.

We need more contributors.
**We need YOU.**

name: Sportas - the best way to play sports with others in London!

name: The Nomadic Entrepreneur - London
description:
The Nomadic Entrepreneur Meetup Group supports the policies and principles of Meetup. We make no guarantees and we do not offer financial services or assurances. All our workshops are FREE To attend.

name: London Socials
description:
Hello friend, welcome to London Socials!


London Socials = awesome people + new experiences


This is our and now your community of friends and friends you just haven't made yet.


Rule number #1 = Be a friend. Act as the best friend you’d want to have.


Join our new Whatsapp group and invite your friends by sharing this link - https://chat.whatsapp.com/FMAqWouiRwE73rHCuFEQog


Socialise with the rest of the London Socials community, join or host your own spontaneous events, be the first to receive updates and get exclusive member rewards.


To help you get the most benefits of belonging to our community and learn more about London Socials, our mission, the community we are growing and how we operate our events to give you the best experiences, please read our Welcome letter here - https://bit.ly/londonsocialswelcome.


Our Mission


Strong authentic relationships are the secret to happiness.


We believe that everybody deserves to have friends and a community of people that inspire them to be their best selves.


We are one of the fastest-growing and most active social Meetup groups in London and the world. 


We’re proud to say 50%+ of our members have rated their experiences with us 10/10 and we’re working hard to make this even better.


Whether you want more people to hang out with or you want to do new and fun things, we've got it covered! 


We organise and host lots of regular social events with hundreds of awesome people.


Since the Coronavirus lockdown started, so many of us have struggled with our mental health, isolation and our social lives. Those that moved to London from another country and are away from their families and loved ones. 


Or those who have lived here for years, perhaps all their lives, and have not managed to build a strong and healthy social life.


London is such a transient mobile city and we can all benefit from having more meaningful, authentic friendships and stronger connections.


We’re literally surrounded by millions of people, yet London still consistently tops lists as the loneliest city in the world. With over 50% of the population saying they feel lonely and find it hard to make friends and a strong social support group here. 


Together, as the London Socials community, we’re going to change this and enjoy the best of what London has to offer.

name: Walks by Water - walking, hiking London
description: Dog friendly Walks by Water takes you on a journey through the landscapes of an England where rivers wind through enchanting countryside, sheer cliffs stand guard beside the mighty sea, swans glide serenely over romantic lakes and ancient canals echo with the toil of thousands of labourers who dug them through the meadows and forests of old. Keep fit, meet interesting and friendly people and see breathtaking sights most of us can only dream of.

name: London Music Showcase - Gigs & Drinks 🙂🍻
description:
https://linktr.ee/londonmusicshowcase
https://youtu.be/pNDpgayHt8Q
https://www.facebook.com/LondonMusicShowcase
https://www.meetup.com/London-Music-Showcase-Gigs-Drinks/
https://www.meetup.com/london-Bands-social-drinks/

This is for friends who like to see Live Music around London. We pick a location to meet for drinks, watch some live bands and then maybe out to a Bar/Club around Central London. It’s a mix of male and female, English and International friends - everyone’s welcome. French, Portuguese, Italian, Spanish, Japanese and English people so I’m sure you will meet someone that shares a passion for Rocking Music.

If you are new to the city and are looking for a good night out in London then feel free to join us. Some events are Free Entry and some are paid gigs with a cheap Guest-List. It's a group for friends to meet people and organise nights out together :)

\-\-\-

The Live Music Industry is unfortunately not what it used to be 20 years ago - Nowadays, an Artist is judged on how many ‘Likes’ and ’Thumbs-Up’ they can get on a Facebook page…

We live in London the MUSIC CAPITAL OF THE WORLD

If you don’t believe that there are amazing nights of music playing all-night long, then you haven’t been paying attention.

I am offering any Band or Artist currently performing around London an Instagram ‘Follow’ if they want it. I have lived here all my life and I know great music events happen everyday because I’ve been there, seen it and I am happy to support it. Last year has probably been the hardest for many Musicians - Nearly all the best Live Music Venues have closed down - BIG RED / LOCK TAVERN / THE MONARCH and many others. Most Alternative Music has been pushed to East LONDON and It's pretty hard getting gigs. So, I will be hosting a few MUSICIANS MEETUPS and I welcome anyone playing music or searching for fellow musicians to come down for a drink 🙂🍻

Over the last 5 years of running this Group, I have had a lot of people come and express an interest in meeting other musicians to form bands. It’s difficult meeting the right people so if you are a Singer, Guitarist, Bassist or Drummer, have a band or think there’s anything we might be interested in then this might be a good group for you.
We put on our own nights and are always looking for great bands to see around London. If you are looking for Gigs or reliable promoters, then we can probably help point you in the right direction.

At the very least, we can talk music and then watch some bands :)

DISCLAIMER:
We are not responsible for you or your belongings. By attending events you agree to waiver liability for the Host :) Please bring ID to all events 18+ Thank you

name: East London Lesbians
description:
Hi and welcome to East London Lesbians Meetup group! This is a friendly and welcoming Meetup group that is supportive of diversity, including bi, trans and nonbinary identities.

We organise regular and one off events to suit all social & cultural tastes. If you fancy a trip to an art gallery, a walk in the woods, or a chat over dinner where you can connect with more people, you have come to the right place. 

Our regular Monthly Meet ups include:

A monthly Supper Club that tours the eateries of East London. Hosted by Róisín and Mel.

A monthly gathering to see the drag show 'Drag Out the Weekend' at the Northcote pub in Leyton/Leytonstone.  A space to catch up with other ELL members, enjoy great gastro pub food and watch a different drag act each month. Hosted by Hebba. https://thenorthcotee11.com/

A monthly Book Club held at the Castle Pub in Walthamstow Village. Hosted by Róisín and Nic.

A monthly low key Board Games Evening at a cosy pub in Walthamstow Village with craft beer and a lovely garden nook. Held on the 1st Monday every month. Hosted by Maria.

A monthly gathering at the Red Lion pub in Leytonstone. Hosted by Kirsten. https://theredlionleytonstone.com/

There are also many other one-off cultural and social events scheduled on our calendar. 

We offer some events that are unlimited in numbers and some that are smaller with a fixed number attending plus a wait list. Smaller groups are arranged for people who prefer a more intimate event and also on occasions where we are limited by numbers e.g. restaurant table sizes. You will always be expected to book your own  tickets for events but we try and make arrangements so we can sit together.

Please RSVP YES only if you wish to join us. We ask that members treat RSVPing to a meet up with the same level of commitment they would an arrangement to meet a friend. You would not just fail to turn up unless it was a major emergency. It's horrible and disheartening to be stood up and it may mean others on the wait list who want to come are prevented from doing so. Organisers and Event Hosts organise the group in their own time and the monthly website subscription fees are paid by the organiser. 

On this basis, if you do not attend a meet up without changing your rsvp to "no"  and cancel at the last minute on two occasions your membership will be cancelled. Obviously, this excludes emergencies. We just ask you let us know in good time that you can't come. 

We encourage members to host events that they are interested in and we would be delighted to support you if you wish to host an event that interests you in an area/venue you're familiar with. Examples of events that members have run include cinema visits, basketball, art walks and walks in Epping Forest. 

We strongly advise that members do not advertise their phone numbers, or any other personal details, in the comments section which is available on every meet up organised. You can email other members within the group or swap numbers when you meet. 

Join us on our private commuity group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/620533788798717/

for news, reviews and international commentary.

Best wishes,

Róisín

name: Social in St. Albans (20s and 30s)
description:
Welcome to the Social in St. Albans Meet Up group! If you are new to St Albans, have been here a while or are just looking to expand your circle and meet people your own age, please come along to our group.

Unfortunately meetup charge us fees depending on the size of the group, so if we do not receive payment, or you have not been active on the site for some time, we will be required to remove you from the group to ensure that it's fair and reasonably priced for all members.
