Meeting ID: 846 2380 713

We also do a live show every Friday in downtown SF at the beautiful Variety Theater in the iconic Hobart Building! One of the longest running independent shows in the country!

([https://www.bestofsfstandup.com](https://www.bestofsfstandup.com))

See you at the show!

name: Dynamics 365 & Power Platform UK User Groups
description:
## Our community

User groups having been running in the UK for over 10 years, starting with a user group for Dynamics CRM in 2011.

Since then, we have expanded in number and in scope, covering not just the traditional ‘CRM’ applications under Dynamics 365 but also the Microsoft Power Platform – Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI and Power Virtual Agents.

Our user groups provide an opportunity for users of Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform to get together, share their knowledge and get to know each other in a fun, open, and welcoming environment. Whatever your level of experience or how long you’ve been using the products, you’re welcome to our meetings!

### Topics

The user group meetings cover all topics under the Dynamics 365 and Power Platform umbrella. We have talks on technical subjects such as development and solution architecture but also cover business perspectives as well, such as user adoption, managing change and business analysis.

### National user group

Our flagship user group – what we call the National user group – runs several events per year. These last all day, have over 15 sessions and typically attract an audience of over of over one hundred people. The events are held at Microsoft’s offices in Reading or London.

### Regional user groups

Our regional user groups cover many areas of the UK. These meetings are typically held in the evening after a working day and have 2 or 3 speakers on topics related to Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform.

name: The Inn Between
description:
PLEASE NOTE: We pride ourselves in cultivating a healthy active membership base. To do this, we encourage members to RSVP to every event, even if you cannot make it. That way we know you are still interested.

‘A place in between worlds for travellers from distant realities to meet and leave their ails behind’

What is the club for? It operates as a board game and table top role playing game meet up for fellow nerds and members of the LGBTQ. We have two dungeons and dragons groups, that meet up on alternating Tuesdays, that are unfortunately now full. If you fancy running your own campaign we are currently looking for DMs. We run board game nights every week on Thursday, with new games being added to our library at each meet up.

A little about me, Aidan, the organiser and founder of this club. My introduction to board games and TTRPGs began with Advanced Dungeons and Dragons, and Talisman. My journey as a nerd continued with games on the original PlayStation, Diablo, Final Fantasy, and Tomb Raider. Then my brother introduced me to novels by Terry Pratchett, the Redwall series, and the Earthsea Quartet by Ursual K. Le Guin. I also dabbled with Warhammer. Safe to say that sealed my identity, and the course of my own personal interests for life. Now I have a space to share and enjoy these interests with others.

name: Islington Locals Meetup Group
description: An Islington based group and neighbouring boroughs (Camden, Hackney, Haringey) for people in their 30's and 40's who are new to Islington or long time residents who are keen to meet their neighbours for; drinks and socialising, dining out, picnics, bottomless brunches, outdoor yoga, karaoke and more! The aim is to embrace and breathe in new life post lockdown (which let's face it was an all round shitty time for everyone). So lets get together meet new people, build new connections and have fun, in a warm, chill, pretense free environment. The events will be a mixture of relax, tame and chill Vs rambunctious, tumultuous and late. A bit of something for everyone ;)

name: MSA - Play, laugh, live
description:
Uniting women together from diverse communities to try many sports and activities together which in the past have not been available to them because they are (i) women and (ii) from ethnically diverse backgrounds.
We have not allowed these to be a barrier. Not only do we provide amazing sessions but we also give outlets and opportunities. We have gone one step further from physical well-being and have also created opportunities for mental and spiritual wellness. We want to build a sisterhood and community you can be proud to be part of whilst leading a healthier lifestyle and learning new skills in a safe and inclusive environment. We are proud to push the boundaries and push women out of their comfort zones to try new sports.

**www.muslimahsports.org.uk**

MSA is open to all females and is a registered charity in Eng & Wales: 1182763. We rely on funding and donations to subsidise activities. We are a volunteer-led charity. 

**When requesting to join please use FULL NAME with valid email address.**

***Winners of British Rowing Project of the Year 2022, Archery GB Participation Project 2021, Outstanding Volunteer, & ‘Spirit of Britain’ 2020, Faith & Belief Awards, FA Grassroots Football Award, FA ‘For All’ Award , & She Awards 2019, London Sports Workforce Award 2018 and The Muslim News Award 2017.***

name: WYBTD? Will You Be There Darling? Gay Men Who Wanna Have Fun
description:
WYBTD (Will You Be There Darling?): Gay Men Who Wanna Have Fun

A free all-encompassing Meetup group for gay men who like to go out, be entertained and socialise. No more missing out on fun events because you have no-one to go with or are reluctant to go alone.

Covering all tribes from the pretentious culture vultures to the unapologetic trashy queens and everyone in between. Whether you are single, partnered or polyamorous there is something for everyone! We don't believe in gender stereotypes (such as masc/fem) or slut-shaming or body-shaming. We are all 'good gays' just maybe some are more shy or socially anxious than others.

All Meetups are organised by a friendly host whose prime responsibility is to ensure all new members are welcomed, introduced to the group and not excluded. We have very quickly built a great reputation for making everyone feel comfortable and welcome.

We don’t believe in boxes, labels or tribes - we are all QUEER! We welcome all MSM (men who have sex with men) regardless of where you belong on the GBTQ+ spectrum. So you are welcome to join us regardless of your social background, income, colour, ethnicity, disability, HIV status, size, age, shape or even hairiness. None of us are equal until ALL of us are equal.


We have been called the “non-judgemental” Meetup group and we are rather proud of that! We love ‘teenagers of all ages’ but we also love queers who want to act either their age or even older, which is why we have events for all ages and personalities. So let’s go out and do more things that make you forget to check your phone!

We believe in disconnecting (at least temporarily!) from our mobile-enabled, click-bait geo-social networks and reconnecting in a meaningful way through face-to-face socialising instead. After all, we live in our brilliant London culture bubble, where we're used to having access to the crème de la crème of entertainment every night of the week, so let's take advantage of it!

We organise Meetup events of all kinds such as art galleries, cabaret, cinema, comedy, dance, museums, music concerts, spoken word poetry and theatre - as well as clubbing nights, cruising bars, drag shows and even sex parties!

A typical weekend's activities might look like this:

Friday: WYBTD Social in a private members club in Soho

Saturday: Art gallery in the afternoon. Off-West End play or independent cinema in the evening, followed by Clubbing

Sunday: Brunch, comedy cabaret afternoon at the Royal Vauxhall Tavern followed by Horse Meat Disco at the Eagle.

So regardless of whether you prefer Hard On or Kylie (or both at the same time!) join one of the most all inclusive Meetup groups for gay men.

Here is an article about WYBTD published recently by Gay Star News: https://www.gaystarnews.com/article/will-you-darling-meetup-london/#gs.972e1z

Here is a discussion thread for members to write some short comments about their first time experiences with WYBTD: https://www.meetup.com/WYBTD-Will-You-Be-There-Darling/discussions/5665472998014976/chat/

If you need to know more - check out the testimonials on the 'group reviews' section here: https://www.meetup.com/WYBTD-Will-You-Be-There-Darling/about/comments/?op=all

WYBTD's founder and main host, Michael, is a veteran of over 1,700 Meetup events! You can now find him on Instagram: michaelgaylondon

WYBTD started on 7 April 2017 and has already more than 6,500 members and a plethora of upcoming events - we have something most days, and sometimes three or four!

Will you be there darling?

name: London Energy Healing and Meditation
description:
We are creating a community of belonging and look forward to gathering with you to explore and seek answers on how to optimize your energy to design the life you want and deserve.
If you are looking for clarity, then this is an opportunity to align your emotional, mental, physical and spiritual self so that you are more tuned and balanced – more you!
We provide:
a way to understand, connect to and use natural psychic gifts.
group meditation opportunities
introductory talks on a variety of subjects, including: active meditation, clearing trauma from the spiritual, mental, physical and emotional energy bodies, increasing intuition, dream interpretation, manifestation, healing relationships, and more.
We hope to meet you soon!

name: Golf and other sports Socialising
description:
Hi! We are a friendly active group mainly for people interested in golf, snooker, table tennis, and occasionally a few other sports/activities (e.g. cycling). Golf events are generally held in east Berkshire or north west Surrey, whilst other activities are mostly held in Ascot, Sunningdale or Windlesham.

Women and men of any age are welcome at our events (see also ' more details' below). Having fun doing sports or activities, whilst perhaps making some friends are the main aims of the group. Please ensure you have a photo of yourself when joining so that we can recognise you and welcome you when attending events (note: photos are only visible to members). Hope to see you soon!

More details:

* Golf - organised most weekends (in Sunningdale, Ascot, or at one of several other nearby courses mainly in east Berkshire and north west Surrey) - usually over 18 holes (but at least once a month over nine). Further details lower down on this page.
* Table tennis - at least once a month - for players of varied ability up to low league standard (though not suitable for complete beginners) - held at Charters leisure centre, Sunningdale
* Snooker (or Pool) (at Lavender park, Ascot - during the week or at the weekend). Some experience needed for snooker.
* Other sports/activities: Cycle rides (leisurely and on quiet roads or off-road) are organised occasionally (in Windlesham or Windsor Great park). Trips to watch sports or to play petanque may also be organised.
* Please say on your profile which of our regular and occasional activities you are interested in! *Note: Badminton used to be organised (and coaching may still be available), but there is at least three other meetup groups in the area who regularly do this sport (plus some 'no strings badminton') further details available from Dave or David).*

*• Note: If you are interested in bridge locally and online please go to: [https://www.meetup.com/Ascot-Sunningdale-Bridge-Meetup/](https://www.meetup.com/Ascot-Sunningdale-Bridge-Meetup/) .*

There are a roughly equal number of men and women in the group, and members are of various ages from 20's to over 60.
Temporary local residents or visitors to the area from other parts or the country or from overseas are welcome to join if they regularly come to the area or before a visit.
\*If the group is 'full' there may be a delay in accepting you in to the group (but this will be done as soon as possible).
\*\*If you are interested in organising a certain activity please contact Dave.
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
\*\*: Golf details: Events are organised at Courses\* to suit experienced, intermediate and improver players mainly. Cost usually £25 to £40 (for 18 holes). The area has some attractive and quite challenging golf courses. Novice golfers are recommended to come to golf at Lavender Park, Blackwater Valley or Billingbear Park. Other courses that we go to are largely only suitable for more experienced players. The golf courses we visit often or sometimes are Sunningdale Heath, Billingbear Park, Chobham, Downshire, Lavender Park, Pine Ridge, Sand Martins, Mill Ride, Royal Ascot, Sherfield Oaks, Hennerton, Hoebridge, Theale, Sutton Green, Pyrford Lakes and Blackwater Valley.
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
Notes:
\*: For 2022 there is a SMALL annual membership charge for active group members (at least), but there is no charge for your first event with the group (if done in the first two years of membership).
\*\*: To keep the membership list up to date; because we have a maximum number of members, probably have a waiting list, and possibly to save money on meetup fees, a FEW/SOME inactive members only who have not paid the annual membership fee may be messaged to check they are still interested and active on Meetup (and if no response removed) or removed:
a) members who have not looked at our meetup site in their first 12 months of membership since the day they joined; or
b) members who have been a member for less than two years, not looked at our meetup site for a year and who have not done any events; or
c) members who have been a member for at least two years, who have not done any events, and who have not looked at our site for at least six months, or
d) any member who has attended events before, who has not done any events in their last 3 years of membership and not looked at our meetup site for at least 12 months.
*\*\*\*Members removed can re-join on payment of the small membership fee. You can live a long way away, but please consider how busy you are on other activities and how far you live or work from the area and whether you will be able to attend events occasionally, before you re-join (note: we rarely do online events).*

name: Lynn & Rina's Fun Nights Out
description:
Hey everyone, Friday meets and Saturday night is party night, right?

So come and party with us and our lovely members.

We, Lynn and Rina will take you to the best funkiest London clubs and party places every Saturday night - fun time guaranteed!! If you've not done any clubbing for a while and you want to get back into it, if you're on your own and you want some friends to party with, or, if you just want a wild time, come join us! Yayy!!

We especially welcome ladies on their own - don't feel nervous or awkward (and MEN too of course), because we'll look after you. We'll introduce you to other people, dance with you and make you feel right at home. You'll soon be one of the gang! Yippee - Love Lynn and Rina XX

name: Django Social / LDN
description:
Inclusive social events for the Django community in a city near you.

The world is opening up again. It's different this time.

So is our vision for Django social events. There is still room for talks, pizza, beers but there is also a better way to make everyone feel welcome.

Django is the common connection here and will be the underlying topic of our social events.

Meeting up hopefully on a monthly-ish basis, in person, in your city.

This group is supported by Foxley Talent

name: Reigate Social Group
description: Whether you’re new to town or have lived here all your life come join us. We are a sociable group who enjoy a variety of events. We’ll have nights out, walks, drinks, meals, other social events plus at least one party a year. If you want to see a particular event organised then please let us know. This group isn’t associated with any business and is purely for social purposes All events are free for members apart from the annual parties.

name: Chinese / Korean / Japanese Society Meetup Group
description:
We are the biggest Far East Asian meetup group in London.  This group is for those who want to experience everything that life has to offer to the fullest, whilst at the same time have fun and make new friends. Perhaps most importantly, the aim of the group is to enjoy ourselves! All are welcome to join provided you share the same ethos!

Planned activities will include: Dim Sum / Yum Cha | Sushi | Language Exchange (Mandarin, Cantonese, Korean, Japanese, Taiwanese, English) | Cinema | Badminton | Sports (Exercise) | Picnics / BBQ / Dinner Nights / Movie Nights | |Day Trips | Holidays Abroad | Camping | Hiking | Sight Seeing | Parties / Clubbing / Drinks | Business Networking | Investment/Finance | Computer Games | Board Games | Anything Else That Members Suggest!

Depending on the number of volunteer organisers and numbers that join, we can have more than one event going on at the same time. Events and activities will be organised once every 1 - 3 weeks and will be based around the themes of food, culture (movies and music), language exchange, keeping fit and healthy, exploring new places and sharing/developing new ideas.

name: Friendly Frolickers 50+ singles Meetup Group
description:
This group is for over 50s singles to meet up, socialise and widen their social circle, in a fun, friendly and safe environment. We are looking for new members to join us, attend and host all kinds of events and holidays.


Travel is my passion and although based in London, our events are not limited geographically. Holidays, travel and adventure are also planned in the UK and abroad.


If you love travel or hope to travel in the future, enjoy socialising, making new friends, outdoor activities, cultural events, restaurants and gatherings or anything and everything that is better shared, then 'Friendly Frolickers' is the Meetup group for you.


Whether you want to just socialise, have short breaks away or travel further afield, you can save money by sharing and make new friends.  Our aim is to plan and offer events at the most reasonable prices by researching and resourcing the best deals.


Friendly Frolickers was initially set up as a WhatsApp group in July 2018 when a group of just 7 people were disillusioned with online dating. The purpose of Friendly Frolickers is for over 50s singles to find new friends in a safe relaxed environment and maybe find a new partner if that's what you are looking for.


There is a £12 annual fee payable on 1st April. This will help to cover the monthly Meetup subscriptions that organisers have to pay for the Meetup service and enable this group to flourish. This fee is non refundable.


Members must be over 50, single and live in the UK. They must also post a photo of themselves on their profile in order to be recognised at the events.


Please only RSVP for events if you are able to attend and remove your name to ‘not going’ as soon as possible if you are unable to attend. This will allow others on the waitlist to take your place.


If you are on a waitlist please remember to keep checking. You will be moved to the ‘going’ list automatically when someone cancels (you will be sent a notification so ensure that you switch them on!).  Please also check your private messages regularly. It’s not unusual for my messages to go unanswered. Very frustrating!


If you have booked an event with a cost involved, please ensure that you make your payment promptly, otherwise you will lose your place and it will be offered to to next member on the list. Often, these ticket deals need to be paid upfront immediately!


If unable to attend an event at last minute, please contact the Host or Organiser as 3 no-shows will result in removal of your profile from the group.


The Organiser and Event Hosts are not tour/travel professionals and as such, are not responsible for your safety, well-being or successful travel/social enjoyment. Please read DISCLAIMER at the foot of this page and decide whether you agree to the conditions of membership of this group.

Only join us if you do.


‼️IMPORTANT‼️By joining you agree to treat other members with respect and tolerance and to refrain from ALL FORMS OF NEGATIVE BEHAVIOUR - intimidation, bullying, stalking, verbal, physical or written abuse and foul language. There is a zero tolerance for these behaviours. Please note that if you do not abide by the rules your profile will be removed and you will be banned from rejoining.


Members must become active within the first 3 months and continue participation at least quarterly. Non-participation in group activities over a 3 month period constitutes the member becoming inactive and their profile may be removed. (Private message me if you have good reason and wish to remain a member).


***************************************


DISCLAIMER

Friendly Frolickers is a club which aims to bring people together to make friends, have fun and find travel buddies through socialising using the Meetup platform.


BY JOINING THIS GROUP YOU AGREE TO THE CONDITIONS BELOW:

Members must satisfy themselves that the event they are attending will be within their physical capabilities and within their personally accepted risk profile before taking part. All members who participate in Friendly Frolickers scheduled events do so at their own risk.

Friendly Frolickers members acknowledge that by joining and attending scheduled events that they have read and understood these conditions.

Organisers and Event Hosts offer no advice nor accept any responsibility for the welfare of its members or guests. It is understood that as adults, all care will be taken to safeguard oneself and be responsible for oneself at all times.


No insurance or assurance for any Friendly Frolickers events is offered and organisers and event hosts shall not be held liable nor have to compensate a member or their guest in any way.

The Organisers, Assistant organisers, Event Hosts or ordinary members cannot be held accountable for any financial loss, injuries, death or otherwise that may occur as a result of an event advertised on the calendar.


Members of this group also need to be aware that the Organisers are not professional travel agents, volunteer their time, have no control over the members in this group and therefore cannot be held responsible for any mishaps or altercations be they verbal, physical or via email, which may occur as a result of utilising this medium to enhance their social life and travel options. These issues will need to be resolved by the parties involved.

When appropriate, the Organiser may approach those who transgress and the Organiser may remove their profiles or ban them from the group.


Members who receive emails via the Friendly Frolickers group site requesting their personal contact details should immediately contact abuse@meetup.com as these requests may be from scamming groups and not Friendly Frolickers members at all. The Organiser would appreciate notification if that occurs.

name: Richmond Scenic Cycling
description:
**RICHMOND SCENIC CYCLING**

Eight years ago I took out a small group of people, one wearing a summer skirt and sandals and off we pedalled. We rode about 8 miles along a flat tow path, we had a lovely day. Each Tuesday we met for our weekly spin but over the months, we found hills and the rides became longer, hybrids were exchanged for road bikes and Garmin was our new best friend.
Today a pretty usual ride might be 50 miles with 2,500 ft Elevation gain - we have become very fit. There are lesser days though and still some off road where we enjoy the countryside and take things a little slower. We are a small and very friendly group and welcome new comers.
However to continue with our "happy Tuesday rides" all new members must have a good level of fitness.

Jane

name: Ladies Only London Social Networking Meet Ups
description:
Hi Ladies
The purpose of this group is to create a social network of professional ladies, whether you run businesses, work a 9-5, or ran the family home, this group is aimed at creating a group of ladies who are passionate, hard working and who motivate and support one another's ideas and projects. And of course have fun!

The main activities in this group will involve dining out in London, however as it grows, we can arrange other events or each others events :)
Let's grow!

name: Social Butterflies (Bracknell & Wokingham)
description:
Social Butterflies is non profit making fun social group for people of all ages, living in and around Bracknell & Wokingham and surrounding areas. The group is run entirely on a voluntary basis for the benefit of its members.

We have weekly events, which include dining out, theatre trips, boat trips, seaside trips, cinema, bowling and lots of other activities, including the occasional break away.

We are also a walking group with walks most weekends as well as midweek walks for those who are able to attend.

There is an annual membership fee of £12 which becomes payable one month after joining. Should you be a member for three months without attending any events then admin will automatically remove you from the group.

For dining out and some other events, a deposit is payable, which will automatically be deducted from your final bill, however please note, any deposit paid is NON-refundable and should you be unable to attend for any reason then that money will automatically go in to the Social Butterflies ‘fun pot’ and be used towards heavily subsidised events such as summer or Christmas parties. No deposits will be carried forward to other events either. The admin involved in refunding or carry overs is simply to great to keep on top of.

Social butterflies has been established for over 3 years and is a successful group. We Welcome new members and we welcome any ideas for events or venues etc. We are a friendly bunch and I look forward to meeting you all.

Many thanks

Anne – Social Butterflies founder and host.

name: West Hertfordshire 30s to 45ish Social
description:
This established Meetup group is aimed for the 30-45 age range in the West Hertfordshire area, particularly in St. Albans, Hemel Hempstead, Berkhamsted and Harpenden. We would love to get like-minded professional people together for social events ranging from pub meets to more active events like walking and sporting activities.
So if you are looking to boost your social life [especially post-lockdown!!], meet new people, have a giggle and enjoy life to the full come and join us!
It would be great to have members organise events so if there is anything you want to see on the events schedule and are happy to lead it, then please contact us directly.

name: London Urban Adventurers
description:
Welcome to London Urban Adventurers. We host occasional leisurely two hour afternoon walks mainly on Mondays. We aim to finish between 4 to 4.30pm. Themes are generally historical, interspersed in the sunny months with away days to the seaside. If there's a local Wetherspoons nearby, we're always spiritually attracted to it for cheap refreshment. Walk fees are still at £3 and payable on the day. Come and enjoy the company by talking to friendly strangers and making new friends.

<br>

Not sure what's going on in the group photo, but it looks like Colin's taking the knee and Mike's apparently been caught rifling his rucksack, although both parties have declined to comment.

<br>

Please be early as we like to set off fairly on time and can only wait 10 minutes.

Don’t forget to cancel via the “Edit RSVP”button if you can’t make a walk.

Messaging other members without permission will result in being removed from the group.

name: London Rams Volleyball Club
description:
London Rams Volleyball Club is a social club based in East London, hosting sessions for intermediate+ level volleyball players to meet new people and have fun

Players attending will be playing their preferred or secondary position, therefore it is a requirement to know 5-1 rotations for your position.

name: 20-30s 華金ロンドン日本人会🇯🇵
description:
このグループはロンドン近郊に住む20〜30代の日本人を中心としたソーシャルグループです。普段英語のみで生活している中で、日本語文化圏同士でわかりあえる、オアシスのような場所になればいいなと思ってます。

\*\*\*This group is not for a language or culture exchange meet-up. If you would like to practise your Japanese, [this language exchange meetup](https://www.meetup.com/London-Language-Exchange-Meetup-Group/) group is the best for it.\*\*\*

メンバーは、日系企業駐在員、国際結婚した方、ワーホリで来た方、欧州生まれの日系人など多彩な方々が参加しています。

暖かい間はピクニック、寒くなればパブなどでイベント開催します！

name: London Singles live music Meetup
description:
https://linktr.ee/londonmusicshowcase
https://youtu.be/pNDpgayHt8Q
https://www.facebook.com/LondonMusicShowcase
https://www.meetup.com/London-Music-Showcase-Gigs-Drinks/
https://www.meetup.com/london-Bands-social-drinks/

This is for friends who like to see Live Music around London. We pick a location to meet for drinks, watch some live bands and then maybe out to a Bar/Club around Central London. It’s a mix of male and female, English and International friends - everyone’s welcome. French, Portuguese, Italian, Spanish, Japanese and English people so I’m sure you will meet someone that shares a passion for Rocking Music.

If you are new to the city and are looking for a good night out in London then feel free to join us. Some events are Free Entry and some are paid gigs with a cheap Guest-List. It's a group for friends to meet people and organise nights out together :)

\-\-\-

The Live Music Industry is unfortunately not what it used to be 20 years ago - Nowadays, an Artist is judged on how many ‘Likes’ and ’Thumbs-Up’ they can get on a Facebook page…

We live in London the MUSIC CAPITAL OF THE WORLD

If you don’t believe that there are amazing nights of music playing all-night long, then you haven’t been paying attention.

I am offering any Band or Artist currently performing around London an Instagram ‘Follow’ if they want it. I have lived here all my life and I know great music events happen everyday because I’ve been there, seen it and I am happy to support it. Last year has probably been the hardest for many Musicians - Nearly all the best Live Music Venues have closed down - BIG RED / LOCK TAVERN / THE MONARCH and many others. Most Alternative Music has been pushed to East LONDON and It's pretty hard getting gigs. So, I will be hosting a few MUSICIANS MEETUPS and I welcome anyone playing music or searching for fellow musicians to come down for a drink 🙂🍻

Over the last 5 years of running this Group, I have had a lot of people come and express an interest in meeting other musicians to form bands. It’s difficult meeting the right people so if you are a Singer, Guitarist, Bassist or Drummer, have a band or think there’s anything we might be interested in then this might be a good group for you.
We put on our own nights and are always looking for great bands to see around London. If you are looking for Gigs or reliable promoters, then we can probably help point you in the right direction.

At the very least, we can talk music and then watch some bands :)

DISCLAIMER:
We are not responsible for you or your belongings. By attending events you agree to waiver liability for the Host :) Please bring ID to all events 18+ Thank you

name: Greater London French Social  Vibe
description:
```
C'est  un meetup pour les personnes intéressées à améliorer leur français et à découvrir la culture française. je m'appelle Alexandra et je parle très bien le français car ma mère est d'origine française. Certains événements seront gratuits tandis que d'autres exigeront des frais à payer en espèces lors de l'événement. Nous nous retrouverons dans des pubs ou des café pour etudier et bavarder.


This is a group for English speakers that want to improve their French. Most of the times we will meet to read and translate a book. This meetings will cost a fee. But there will be free staff too going on.. You can donate offers if you reckon this is fair, for the time I spend organising all this. If there is a special event, for example it is your birthday, please do not hesitate to let me know and I will organise a special event for you. 
```

name: London Job Search Meetup
description:
This Group is for Job Seekers interested in Career Development, Job Search, Job Search Strategies and Networking where we can share knowledge, skills, experience and make friends...So anything career related this group is for you!!
This group is to assist people find their next job in UK.

This Meetup group is tailored towards all London area Job Seekers, Hiring Managers, and Recruiters/HR Professionals that are either looking for a job, looking to hire someone, or looking to expand their current network. Our events are mostly geared towards connecting Job Seekers with those Hiring Managers and Recruiters that have matching openings. This group is a great place for all professionals (including those that are already working), to network and build connections, which can be utilized to enhance long-term career growth and personal development. In addition, we will also collaborate with local nonprofit organizations to strengthen community ties and support the important services they provide to the people of the United Kingdom.
We invite speakers and conduct sessions around job search strategies, resume writing, interviews, LinkedIn profiles and all things important for finding that next job.

I would like to personally welcome you to the meetup and look forward to seeing you at the next event.
Simon

name: Debate London
description:
## Nice To Meet You! We're Debate: London

Join us and we will teach you how to speak in public, think strategically, and deal with conflict. We will then give you a platform to lead by example in our monthly debates, that are free to attend and open to all, so you can show those in search of a more civil way to examine our differences what it really means to be a great debater.

We provide 2 types of events:
Public Speaking and Debate Training workshops - Instead of inviting guest speakers to sit on our debate panels, we train our members to defend the competing perspectives shaping the debate in their own words and develop the skills that allow our members to tackle any topic and find the arguments for any side.

Public debates - Every 1st and 3rd Wednesday of the month we debate issues that divide public opinion, which this year ranged from inducting Ukraine into NATO and deposing Boris Johnson to falling UK birth rates and fake news. Topics are expressed not as a question, but as a proposal that the audience must vote to accept or reject after hearing all the arguments.

name: SMUGs! Local events for local people.
description:
As restrictions begin to lift we will slowly resume our "in person" meetups while still keeping some of our online events. Please respect that some members may feel more nervous than others about socialising in groups.




Hello! Meet local people who like to do a range of things that you like too, in and around Sunbury and the surrounding areas. We generally have a couple of events on each week. If you have any suggestions for events, just let us know. 

Our member general age range is 50's/60's+ although any age can join.

We like to laugh a lot, dance a lot (if you can call it dancing . . . ), eat a lot(!), quiz a lot, play sports a bit and generally have a go at anything that's a bit of fun. We try to keep it local but happy to go further afield for the right event. It costs £1 to RSVP for an event as a casual member, or £15 annual membership for a full member and that's just to cover the running costs. Casual members just bring it with you to the event. (PLEASE NOTE THAT THE BADMINTON IS PLAYED SOCIALLY, USING SMUGs RULES, NOT SEMI-PROFESSIONALLY.)

We've been going since October 2011, events are generated by our members and its been a real laugh so far . . . Come and join us!

IMPORTANT NOTICES: 

1. SMUGs hope you will enjoy participating in any events it organises and that you will understand your own obligations in terms of health & safety whilst doing so. 

Members should ensure that they are physically capable of taking part in activities, and where appropriate have taken medical advice before participating. 

Members also consent to their photograph, images and any videos being used on the web-site or in any related publicity material.

By applying and subsequently being accepted as a member, you agree to these terms and conditions, including waiving legal rights, and do so by your own free will.

2. If members do not access the site for six months, they will automatically be deleted. Ex-members are welcome to rejoin at any time.

name: Marina dance classes
description:
🙌🏻Hey! Welcome!😊

I’m Marina, dancer from Argentina🇦🇷, and would love to dance with you! Here’s a sneak peek: @marina.dance2life ✨

❤️‍🔥Let's have fun, do exercise, connect with others and uplift ourselves by dancing!🕺🏼

❤️‍🔥My classes are open to everyone who is looking for a different experience in a non-competitive space that we create all together - join me and feel the vibe!✨

🤩Looking forward to dancing together! Check out my events for more information about classes description, prices and schedule!🙌🏻

name: The Intrepid Entrepreneur London
description:
The Intrepid Entrepreneur Group is about helping budding entrepreneurs, beginners, start-ups etc. to get started in building their own online business.
We want to lend help, support and guidance to each other and give direction. Helping people understand what they really want in life and providing guidance to get them where they want to be.
Anyone who is wanting to make a few extra pounds per week to supplement what they already have can do so as there are so many opportunities out there to explore. We can help.
If anyone is wanting a completely new direction that requires completely new skills, we can help.
By holding regular, online meetings, we can all help each other to gain the confidence, skills, and development that are required get us where we want to be.

name: London Restaurant Previews and Deals
description: We'll seek out London's newest Restaurant Openings / Previews / Soft Launches / Promos where we can sample their dishes at a discounted rate. It's become the recent trend that when a new trendy restaurant opens in London, that they offer a "Soft Launch" period, when more often that not, 50% is offered off the food bill. We'll also post events when a Restaurant offers a deal on a certain day of the week, like 50% off Steaks on a Monday.

name: Hit & Run Badminton club
description:
Hi everyone... We are social badminton club... Opening our door for new players that would llke to join us... We play every week THURSDAY 3 HR & SUNDAY 3 HOUR, we have regular members that join in session... We been running this Club for Few years.. playing in Hammersmith & Middlesex League .. So if you would like to try out social and some challenging game you can give us a try sometime..




FYI... I am sad to say... It might not be suitable for beginners or lower level players... Club sessions is always Intermediate to higher intermediate players.. So it might not to fair or suitable..

name: Weekday Walks - walking, hiking London
description: This dog friendly group is for those in their 20s to 70s, appealing to students, tourists or long-term visitors, shift workers , part time workers , the relatively recent retired or anyone else who may happen to have free time during the week , to enjoy daytime walks in mostly wonderful natural surroundings of between 7 and 11 miles in length plus possibly some shorter walks of 3 to 5 miles during the week either in London itself or by easy reach by train journey.

name: Mishoni - London Japanese/English Meetup Group
description: If you live in or near London and want to make new friends with Japanese and international people, then this group is for you. In our group, we will organise regular events in London that allow you to make new Japanese and international friends. We hope that our members can help each other to improve their Japanese or English skills, share experiences with each other and help to enjoy London more. We hope that you can make lots of new friends in our group.

name: Sapphists Hertfordshire
description:
This is a social group to bring Women Who Love Women together,  build a friendly, active over 18s WLW network in Hertfordshire and have fun!




Meet-ups are a great way to meet new people and connect so come along to one of the social events and say hi. We are a really friendly, welcoming bunch!




We have a great group of organisers, of varying ages, all of whom bring very different life experiences and perspectives to the mix.  In 2022 we are combining Sapphists Hertfordshire with Hitchin Sapphic Socials, and have added a mid Herts event organiser, so we hope you can find something for you not too far from home.  During the last couple of years, spurred on by the desire to address social isolation amongst our Herts LGBTQ+ community, we have enjoyed pub and meal nights, picnics, beach volleyball, book groups, walks, theatre trip, Hertfordshire Pride, North Herts Pride picnic etc.  Some great friendships have developed between some members, and we have been supportive just by being there for each other.




We hope that the group will grow and develop over time so please do chat to us about your ideas. If there is something you would like to see as part of this group then let us know.




We look forward to meeting you soon!

Event Organiser Jacqui - Living in Brighton for almost 15 years I always felt part of a community as LGBTQ+ is part of the fabric of the city. It felt different when I moved to Hitchin so I started a local group to help people feel connected to a wider community and have fun!




Group Organiser Gillian - After discovering I am lesbian in my 40s/50s, I met and married a woman and moved to another county.  Returning alone to Watford a few years ago, I began to realise I had absolutely no connection with women who love women here!  I joined Meetup and Facebook groups, have enjoyed some great events, and have made many valuable new friends.




Event Organiser Sharon - I joined the group to socialise with like minded people and have made some lovely new friends.  I’ve enjoyed various nights out with the Sapphists ladies, from meals out, karaoke, book clubs, music to Prides.  Lots of fun and laughter to be had.




Event Organiser Jenny - I realised I was gay later than most people my age and then felt like I was the only gay in the village.  It seemed like all Lesbian/Bi events were in London and there was nothing in the countryside.  Going to my first LGBTQ+ Meetup was a game changer for me and this group has played a wonderful part in my journey.  So for me helping organise events is my way of paying it forward.  You couldn’t ask for a nicer group of people.

name: Spanish London - English / Spanish Language Practice
description:
Join us for a regular English/Spanish meetup where you can practice your English or Spanish in a relaxed and inclusive environment. We organise English/Spanish language exchanges, events and opportunities to practise your English/Spanish.

We look to promote the language and culture between the UK and Spanish speaking countries. We welcome anyone with an interest to join us! See you soon!

Únase a nosotros para una reunión regular de inglés/español donde puede practicar su inglés o español en un ambiente relajado e inclusivo. Organizamos intercambios de idioma inglés/español, eventos y oportunidades para practicar su inglés/español.

Nos fijamos en promover el idioma y la cultura entre el Reino Unido y los países de habla hispana. ¡Le damos la bienvenida a cualquier persona con interés en unirse a nosotros! Nos vemos pronto!

name: Escape the Rat Race - Become Financially Free!
description:
**Inflation, the cost of living crisis and numerous other headwinds are causing many people to sink! The pressure is increasing and time is running out to make yours and your family's financial position secure so that you can continue to thrive even in uncertain times.**

**We’ve put together some of the top coaches to help you implement straightforward strategies and methods to earn powerful streams of income and to build and secure wealth. This group has been formed to help you survive and thrive.**

**By attending the events and listening to our top coaches we can provide you with the tools and mindset to become financially free and to build wealth.**

**Whether you are in a full time job and looking to earn a second income, or you are looking to earn a large enough income to give up your day job we have strategies and tools required to help you reach your goals and become financially free!**

**Whatever your financial situation, if you want viable tried and tested ways to earn more money then this is the group for you.**

name: London Wine Meetup
description: This Meetup group is for those that want to discover London's wide range of wine bars, as well as wine tasting and other wine events.

name: Golden Girls (London Lesbians 50 plus)
description:
This group is for older lesbian women who want to get out and about during the day and have fun in and around London. Most members will be over 50 but age is no barrier to belonging.

Events will include walks, dinners, boat rides, posh picnics (with chairs and tables), matinees, art galleries and museums . . . and much, much more! 

Membership and attendance is free of charge but a non-refundable deposit will sometimes be required for dinner and other bookings where it's important that everyone turns up.

Numbers attending will be limited to enable everyone to get to talk to each other and to promote a friendly, welcoming atmosphere and sense of community.

name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets
description:
**For: Acoustic musicians, singer-songwriters, classical musicians and musical instrument & world music players!**

(Not for: Drum N Bass, Rap, RnB, Soul, Funk, Electronica or X factor style commercial music)

**Who Should Join: Solo acoustic instrumentalists, singer-songwriters, session players, keen musicians who know their way around their instrument; those looking for ensemble playing experience and performance. We are not an Open Mic. Meet-up is just one platform we use and we currently trial Meet-up to see whether this is worth continuing with.**

**What we do at events:** We are a new independent start-up! Acoustic Music is core to our emotional well-being, down the the rhythm of our heartbeat. We promote being well and healthy through music and developing a small local community of budding musicians who are otherwise isolated and disconnected from growing with other musicians.

2 hours long acoustic music sessions limited to a max of 8 musicians. We work on shared and agreed music repertoire and play as an ensemble or session. We have our own performance space and audience in the acoustic cafe coffeehouse style.

We currently run 5 acoustic music meet ups:

**1\. Classical Chamber Meet\-up: Saturdays 3\.00pm \[sessional depending on players\]**
**2\. Singer\-Songwriter Indie Alternative Session: Saturdays 5\.00pm**
**3\. Alt\. Folk Acoustic Session: Wednesday 6\.00pm**
**4\. London Chinese Music Instrument Music Meetup: Sundays 2\.00pm \[Private\]**
**5\. World Music \[Acoustic instruments only\] Meet up \[NEW\]: Sundays 2pm** 

**1\. Classical Music & Chamber Music Meet\-up:** If you know your way around your classical instrument (cello, violin, flute, clarinet etc), and are interested in meeting like minded instrumentalists to grow and nurture classical ensemble playing- drop us a message with your instrument and repertoire interest! We work out scores with parts we can rehearse and put together.

**2\. Acoustic Indie Alternative Sessions:** Unlike Open Mics, we work around each others' songs and songwriting, traditional folk and original songs creating instrument parts from the collective of musicians. By alternative, we refer to the spirit of alternative music in its non-commercial, non-saccharin lyrics and non-pop structure.

**3\. Alt\. Folk:** we started off performing as folk musicians and love folk music by T Bone Burnett, Wovenhand, Jason Isbell and the Indigo Girls. We play loosely and openly embrace new twists and turns to folk music. We're definitely not oldtimer style!

**4\. London Chinese Music Instrument Meet up:** Private session. Interested players committed to performing and long term playing are welcome to enquire. From time to time we invite new members.

**5\. World Music \[Acoustic\] Meet up:** open to anyone who plays or sings (ethnic) world music acoustically. First meeting scheduled for Sunday 3rd May 2022 @ 2pm

**Email: thefilmatelierse6@gmail.com**

name: London Theatre & Film Meetup
description:
**A Social group for People who enjoy WestEnd Theatre and Film Shows!**
**Maybe a bit passionate... serious theatre and film goers needed!**
What we do is to get a group of like minded individuals (That's YOU) to get together and watch Theatre and Films in London, with a **bit of socialising** throw in - I have met some really lovely interesting people. We are a **busy** group and see more than just one or two shows a month!
We love theatre in with A-listed stars in them, musicals, fringe, tear jerkers, films with George Clooney, serious dramas, indie films, cult classics, comedy, opera in fact anything goes. The only criteria for joining is you love the Theatre and Film, so become one of us!!!!

name: Женские встречи. Лондон
description:
Добро пожаловать в группу «Женские встречи. Лондон»

Мы знакомимся, общаемся и становимся подругами! 

Потому что живое общение:
